author: Martin U
title: Juventus must consider Douglas Luiz a bad signing and sell him soon
text:
The latest update on Douglas Luiz’s situation at Juventus reveals that the Brazilian midfielder has been placed on a personal training program to aid his development and integration into the team. Luiz arrived in Turin with high expectations after a stellar season with Aston Villa, where he established himself as one of the best midfielders in Europe. His performances in the Premier League earned him admiration from top clubs, and Juventus fans believed they had secured a major coup by signing the talented midfielder.
When Luiz made the move to Juventus, there was genuine excitement among supporters and optimism from manager Thiago Motta. The Bianconeri were confident they had acquired a player capable of transforming their midfield, providing creativity, energy, and technical quality. However, reality has not aligned with those initial expectations, as Luiz has struggled to adapt to life in Turin .
Fitness problems have plagued his early days at the club, limiting his ability to settle into Motta’s system and find consistency on the pitch. More concerning, Luiz often appears out of place in Juventus’ tactical setup, unable to perform at the level that once made him a standout in England. His lack of sharpness and inability to influence games have been frustrating for the club, which now faces a dilemma about his future.
Juventus have taken steps to address his struggles by implementing a specialized training program aimed at improving his physical fitness and understanding of the team’s playing style. While this approach demonstrates patience and a willingness to help Luiz adapt, there are growing concerns that he may simply not be the right fit for Thiago Motta’s system.
It may be time for the Bianconeri to reconsider their decision. Forcing Luiz into a role that does not align with his natural strengths risks limiting his potential and wasting valuable time. He is a talented player who could thrive at another club with a system more suited to his style of play. Instead of persisting with a strategy that has yet to bear fruit, Juventus might need to accept that signing Luiz was a mistake and consider cutting their losses sooner rather than later.
Ultimately, while Douglas Luiz possesses an undeniable quality, his future may lie elsewhere. Juventus would be wise to focus on players who seamlessly fit into Motta’s vision, as time and resources spent trying to reshape Luiz could be better utilized elsewhere.
